title: Ticket #1024: Only link gSOAP into daemons with a SOAP interface
description:
SOAP support for daemons is provided by DaemonCore. The details of how gSOAP handles method dispatching are exposed to DaemonCore. The result is all programs that link with daemoncore.a must also provide gSOAP stubs, e.g. must have a SOAP interface. Historically, all daemons were given a default interface (GetVersion, GetPlatform). The only daemons with a meaningful interface beyond the default are condor_schedd, condor_collector and condor_soapshell.

In so much as the gSOAP dependency: is unnecessary for most deamons, introduces a linking dependency for all daemons (overhead), and complicates the creation of new daemons; it is proposed that the dependency be broken.

The proposal to break the dependency is:

  • Insulate DaemonCore from gSOAP [DONE]
    • Create a dc_soap interface encapsulating the gSOAP logic: soap_core.cpp [DONE]
    • Provide an implementation of dc_soap for daemons with no SOAP interface: no_soap_core.cpp [DONE]
    • Include the no_soap_core.o in daemoncore.a [DONE]
  • Remove all default SOAP interfaces [DONE]
    • Introduce SOAP_LIB for linking into daemons with a SOAP interface [DONE]
    • Remove all gsoap_*.h default interfaces [DONE]
    • Remove all soap_*Stub.cpp default interfaces [DONE]
    • Update condor_schedd/collector/soapshell to use SOAP_LIB [DONE]
  • Provide a solution for Windows [DONE]
    • Either, figure out equivalent of ELF/a.out __attribute__((weak)) support for Windows [N/A on windows]
    • Or, setup Windows targets to link against soap_core.cpp,mimetypes.cpp and no_soap_core.cpp where appropriate [DONE]
derived_tickets: #1034   Enable soap test on Windows
